intro: Prosopostelma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has linear, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow with a central disc, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Prosopostelma is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
